name: Unique Factorization Domain
definition:
A **unique factorization domain** (UFD) is a ring $R$ in which every non-zero element $x$ which is not a unit can be written as a finite product of irreducible elements
$$ x= p_1p_2\ldots p_n$$ with $n\ge 1$ and this representation is unique in the sense that if $x=q_1\ldots q_m$ with $m\ge 1$ then $m=n$ and there exists a bijection between the $p_i$ and the $q_i$ such that the image $q_j$ of $p_i$ is associated with $p_i$.
